image.altText: A waitrees looks to the side as she holds a cup of coffee balanced on a saucer

props.synopsis: An expansion to the ACT's portable long service leave scheme, which allows those in casual or insecure work to access the entitlement even if they switch employers, is being put on hold amid the ongoing cost-of-living crisis.

title.children: 'Tough time' for businesses delays expansion of ACT leave scheme

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaking at a podium.

props.synopsis: The leader of the federal Liberal Party is making some big announcements, including plans to sack thousands of public servants. It is 1951.

title.children: Who came up with the idea to cut thousands of public service jobs?

image.altText: A man in a kayak holds onto a hot air balloon.

props.synopsis: During the Canberra Balloon Spectacular, pilot Justin Galbraith bounces the basket of his hot air balloon across the surface of Lake Burley Griffin and throws out a towline to pull along hundreds of kayakers and paddle-boarders in his wake.

title.children: Hot air balloons tow kayakers and boarders in 'world's slowest water sport'

image.altText: A smartphone with an Airbnb logo on it in front of the same logo being projected on a screen.

props.synopsis: From July 1 short-term rental accommodation bookings of less than 28 days, made on booking services like Airbnb and Stayz, will pay a five per cent levy in the ACT.

title.children: Canberra short-term rental booking levy to 'level the playing field'

image.altText: A building with a sign 'Queanbeyan Courthouse'

props.synopsis: A NSW woman previously charged for hitting her 13-year-old son while chastising him for disobeying a technology ban has successfully appealed her conviction.

title.children: Woman who hit son during technology ban row wins conviction appeal

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair holds up a moth-eaten knitted blanket.

props.synopsis: Releasing 10,000 of microscopic wasps into a home may not sound like the most obvious way to tackle a moth infestation, but it is an effective one.

title.children: These tiny wasps may help protect your clothes and pantry from moths

image.altText: A laughing clowns game in sideshow alley.

props.synopsis: The tradition of the annual show is under threat according to organisers who say volunteers are burnt out by the long hours and reams of paperwork it takes to run them.

title.children: Country shows at risk as volunteer organisers jump through 'endless hoops'

image.altText: Detective Sargeant Chris Watson

props.synopsis: For the first time, the lead police investigator on the case is speaking about how they found those responsible for the death of Glenn Walewicz.

title.children: 'Not deserving of this': Glenn Walewicz police investigator speaks for the first time

image.altText: Travis Lovett stands in the ruins of Lake Condah mission.

props.synopsis: Australia has a painful past. For the first time, the country has been grappling with recording the stories of that history in a truth-telling commission.

title.children: These crimes were hidden for generations. Now Australia's having a moment of truth

image.altText: A man in a navy blue suit, white shirt and blue tie with short grey hair smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: Struggling to gain traction at home after taking the top job, UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer's performance on the international stage has been received differently.

title.children: Keir Starmer was struggling in the polls. Then he met Donald Trump

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump's face.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's attacks on the judiciary pre-election, as he personally fought criminal prosecution, was one thing. But the way it's escalating from the White House is stress-testing the separation of powers.

title.children: President vs judge: Deportations test Donald Trump's respect for law

image.altText: Donald Trump grinning next to a US flag while wearing a dark suit and maroon checked tie

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump rescinds the security clearances of former Democratic rivals Joe Biden, Kamala Harris and Hillary Clinton, as well as several other officials.

title.children: Trump revokes security clearances for Biden, Harris and Clinton

image.altText: A plume of smoke rising from a hill with houses on it in Lebanon

props.synopsis: Israel strikes Lebanon in retaliation for rockets targeting Israel, killing two, including a child, in the heaviest exchange of fire since the ceasefire with the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah.

title.children: Israel strikes Lebanon in response to cross-border rocket fire

image.altText: A woman with her arms resting over a balcony railing.

props.synopsis: A short walk from the heart of Lismore are a bunch of homes among the gum trees on a dead end road called Pine Street. They call it a community, but the law calls it illegal.

title.children: Lismore squatters remain defiant in the face of the government's demolition threats

image.altText: Dark clouds over Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Experts say infrastructure in south-east Queensland and northern New South Wales needs to be built to withstand cyclones.

title.children: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred a 'dress rehearsal' for events to come

image.altText: Torsos of two people in police uniforms, with a focus on a holstered taser on one person's uniform.

props.synopsis: Concerns have been raised about the bail process for NSW Police officers charged with domestic violence-related offences, with a former magistrate saying the decision should be made independently of police.

title.children: Fears for DV victims as accused police officers granted bail by colleagues

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A woman in a tiara sits in the back of a car with a man in full military uniform

props.synopsis: At the age of 24, a brash and fiery Princess Anne was called "her royal rudeness" by the British tabloids. But when a man brandishing two guns tried to kidnap her outside Buckingham Palace, Anne's sharp tongue helped save her life.

title.children: How a fiery Princess Anne talked her way out of being kidnapped in 1974

image.altText: Lilie James, who was killed at St Andrew's Cathedral School in Sydney's CBD on October 25, 2023, smiling in an undated selfie

props.synopsis: The man who murdered Lilie James was meticulous, calculated and calm. This was not a momentary loss of control, he knew what he was doing, an inquest into her death was told this week.

title.children: Friends mistook it as love. But Lilie James's killer was controlling

image.altText: A woman on a balcony with a sunset behind her smiling

props.synopsis: Psychologists say a ritual or celebration can help a person move forward from a difficult phase of their life.

title.children: 'Shedding the past': How celebrating her divorce helped Leigh move on

image.altText: A photo of a capsized boat with people on its head

props.synopsis: The boat was carrying 13 people, including 11 Australian tourists, when it capsized in rough seas off Bali.

title.children: Australian woman killed as snorkelling boat capsizes off Bali

image.altText: Grey beard man wearing white t-shirt and cowboy hat, leaning against fence, dam behind

props.synopsis: A property owner who wants to open his share of "God's country" to tourists says he is excited to get started after a lengthy and expensive legal fight to build an eco-resort.

title.children: Tiny homes boss ordered to plant 20,000 seedlings in eco-resort trade-off

image.altText: Tom Gleeson stands at a podium with the Hard Quiz sign to his left.

props.synopsis: You just couldn't stay away, could you? Let's see how poorly you do this week. It’s time to play, HARD!

title.children: Think you're smart? Show us what you've got

image.altText: Sheets of perscription medication.

props.synopsis: Nearly 500,000 Australians could be missing out on hundreds of dollars in savings at the pharmacy each year because of poor understanding and uptake of the country's "clunky" pharmaceutical safety net scheme.

title.children: Close to 500k Australians could have missed out on savings at the pharmacy

image.altText: A woman in a yellow Australia shirt holds a lacrosse stick above her head with a ball in it the net. She's wearing goggles.

props.synopsis: After an 80-year hiatus, lacrosse is returning to the Olympic program in time for 2028. Members of Australia's women's team say there has never been more excitement surrounding the sport.

title.children: Under-the-radar Australian team out for 2028 glory in returning Olympic sport

image.altText: A woman with a blonde bob smiles in her kitchen while showing off a jar of pickled carrot peels

props.synopsis: Rebecca Buckley is getting creative to keep food on the table amid skyrocketing expenses. As more people face food insecurity in the cost-of-living crisis, researchers warn it can lead to disordered eating.

title.children: Rebecca went from survival mode to self-care when facing food insecurity

image.altText: A bald man gestures with his fist in the boxing action

props.synopsis: US heavyweight boxing champion and businessman George Foreman, who famously took on Muhammad Ali in the "Rumble in the Jungle", has died aged 76.

title.children: US boxer George Foreman dies aged 76

image.altText: Cherneka Johnson poses with her world title belt after defeating Nina Hughes in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Cherneka Johnson retains her WBA bantamweight belt with a dominant win, while George Kambosos survives a fierce test against Jake Wyllie in their super-lightweight showdown.

title.children: Aussie Johnson retains bantamweight belt, Kambosos earns title shot

image.altText: Oscar Piastri climbs into his McLaren F1 car.

props.synopsis: Australian driver Oscar Piastri will start Sunday's Chinese Grand Prix from the front of the grid after taking pole in qualifying in Shanghai.

title.children: Oscar Piastri snares first F1 pole position in China

image.altText: Jade Cook sitting at bar bench smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: What do global TV hit Bridgerton and outback Queensland have in common? A thriving social season filled with courtship and romance.

title.children: The tiny town 'in the middle of nowhere' where couples fall in love

image.altText: Pope Francis grinning while wearing white robes and a silver Catholic cross chain and waving with his left hand

props.synopsis: Pope Francis will offer a blessing to the public from his hospital room window in Rome on Sunday.

title.children: Pope Francis set to make his first appearance in five weeks

image.altText: A yellow, orange, red sign that reads Humpty Doo Community & Child Care Centre. Animated animals pictured also

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory coroner has heard harrowing evidence about an incident at a childcare centre in Humpty Doo which led to the death of a 22-month-old girl in 2023.

title.children: Toddler likely fatally trapped by common pool fence at childcare, coroner hears

image.altText: A camera crew working on the edge of a lake in Tasmanian landscape, with a mountain behind reflected in the water

props.synopsis: Australian writer and producer Vicki Madden is bringing the Scandinavian noir style to Australian screens. What makes Tasmania so well-suited to the genre?

title.children: Inspired by Scandinavian TV, Tassie noir is cold, dark and riveting
